title: Refactor: Extract note enrichment logic to shared method
description:
Nearly identical note enrichment logic (reading content + tags) is duplicated in getAllNotes() and searchNotes() in notesService.ts.

Location: src/services/notesService.ts (lines 86-108, 181-203)
Impact: High - ~40 lines duplicated
Approach: Extract to private enrichNoteWithContent() helper method

title: Fix: Standardize error handling in store actions
description:
Inconsistent error handling across notesStore actions. updateNote() doesn't reset isLoading: false on error, causing UI to hang.

Location: src/renderer/stores/notesStore.ts (updateNote at lines 87-105)
Impact: High - UI bug, leaves loading state active on failure
Approach: Create withLoading() wrapper for consistent error handling

title: Phase 2: Define Catppuccin color palettes and CSS variable system
description:
## Description
Create the theming system with Catppuccin color definitions and CSS custom properties for runtime theme switching.

## Tasks
- Create catppuccin.ts with all 4 flavor palettes (Latte, Frappé, Macchiato, Mocha)
- Define semantic color tokens mapped to Catppuccin colors
- Create theme.css with CSS custom properties
- Create theme classes (.theme-latte, .theme-frappe, etc.)
- Create ThemeProvider.svelte component

## Files to Create
- src/renderer/themes/catppuccin.ts (color definitions)
- src/renderer/themes/theme.css (CSS variables)
- src/renderer/components/ThemeProvider.svelte (theme wrapper)

## Catppuccin Color Reference
Use official Catppuccin palette

Required semantic tokens:
- base (main background)
- surface (panels/cards)
- text (primary text)
- subtext (secondary text)
- accent (primary accent)
- border (borders)
- hover (hover states)

## Acceptance Criteria
- All 4 Catppuccin themes defined with complete color palettes
- CSS variables support runtime theme switching
- ThemeProvider loads and applies theme on mount

## Reference
See CATPPUCCIN_THEME_PLAN.md Phase 2

title: Phase 5: Build theme selector UI component
description:
## Description
Create a user-facing UI component for selecting between the 4 Catppuccin themes.

## Tasks
- Create ThemeSelector.svelte component
- Add radio buttons or dropdown for theme selection
- Display theme names (Latte, Frappé, Macchiato, Mocha)
- Connect to theme store
- Integrate into App.svelte or settings menu

## Files to Create/Modify
- src/renderer/components/ThemeSelector.svelte (new)
- src/renderer/components/App.svelte (integrate selector)

## Acceptance Criteria
- User can see all 4 theme options
- Clicking a theme applies it immediately
- Current theme is visually indicated
- Theme persists after app restart

## Reference
See CATPPUCCIN_THEME_PLAN.md Phase 3, Task 3.3

title: Phase 1: Add preferences database and IPC infrastructure
description:
## Description
Implement the backend foundation for storing and retrieving user preferences, starting with theme selection.

## Tasks
- Add preferences table migration to database schema
- Create preferencesRepository.ts with get/set methods  
- Create preferencesService.ts with getTheme/setTheme methods
- Add IPC handlers in preferencesHandlers.ts
- Expose IPC methods in preload.ts (getTheme, setTheme)

## Files to Create/Modify
- src/database/migrations.ts (add preferences table)
- src/database/preferencesRepository.ts (new)
- src/services/preferencesService.ts (new)
- src/ipc/preferencesHandlers.ts (new)
- src/preload.ts (expose theme IPC methods)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Preferences table exists in database
- Can store and retrieve theme preference via IPC
- Default theme is mocha
- Follows existing repository/service patterns

## Reference
See CATPPUCCIN_THEME_PLAN.md Phase 1

title: Phase 3: Create theme state management with Zustand
description:
## Description
Add theme state management to the renderer process using Zustand store pattern.

## Tasks
- Create themeStore.ts with Zustand store
- Add currentTheme state (latte | frappe | macchiato | mocha)
- Implement loadTheme() action to fetch from IPC
- Implement setTheme(theme) action to update IPC and state
- Integrate with ThemeProvider component

## Files to Create/Modify
- src/renderer/stores/themeStore.ts (new)
- src/renderer/components/ThemeProvider.svelte (connect to store)

## Store Structure
interface ThemeState {
  currentTheme: 'latte' | 'frappe' | 'macchiato' | 'mocha';
  isLoading: boolean;
  loadTheme: () => Promise<void>;
  setTheme: (theme: string) => Promise<void>;
}

## Acceptance Criteria
- Theme store follows existing Zustand patterns (see notesStore.ts)
- Theme state is reactive across components
- IPC calls are properly async/await
- Loading states handled during theme changes

## Reference
See CATPPUCCIN_THEME_PLAN.md Phase 3, Task 3.1

title: Phase 4: Refactor components to use CSS variables
description:
## Description
Replace all hard-coded colors in components with CSS custom properties for theme support.

## Tasks
- Update Sidebar.svelte (buttons, backgrounds, borders, hover states)
- Update EditorView.svelte (backgrounds, spinners, delete button)
- Update EditorToolbar.svelte (toolbar background, button states)
- Update Editor.svelte (TipTap prose styles, code blocks, blockquotes)
- Update app.css (global styles, base resets)
- Update index.css if needed

## Color Mappings
Replace hard-coded colors with CSS variables:
- #ffffff → var(--color-base)
- #3b82f6 → var(--color-accent)
- #e5e7eb → var(--color-border)
- #111827 → var(--color-text)
- #6b7280 → var(--color-subtext)
- #f9fafb → var(--color-surface)

## Files to Modify
- src/renderer/components/Sidebar.svelte
- src/renderer/components/EditorView.svelte
- src/renderer/components/EditorToolbar.svelte
- src/renderer/components/Editor.svelte
- src/renderer/app.css

## Acceptance Criteria
- No hard-coded hex colors remain in components
- All themes render correctly without visual regressions
- TipTap editor is readable in all 4 themes
- Hover states and active states work in all themes

## Reference
See CATPPUCCIN_THEME_PLAN.md Phase 3, Task 3.2

title: Phase 6: Integration, testing, and polish
description:
## Description
Final integration of theme system, comprehensive testing across all themes, and polish for production.

## Tasks
- Ensure ThemeProvider wraps App in renderer.ts
- Test theme initialization on app start
- Verify theme persistence across app restarts
- Test all 4 themes in every component
- Check TipTap editor in all themes
- Verify accessibility (contrast ratios)
- Test theme switching performance
- Update documentation if needed

## Testing Checklist
- Latte theme: All components visible and readable
- Frappé theme: All components visible and readable
- Macchiato theme: All components visible and readable
- Mocha theme: All components visible and readable
- Theme persists after closing and reopening app
- No console errors during theme switching
- Editor content remains editable in all themes
- Code blocks readable in all themes
- Tag colors work in all themes

## Optional Enhancements
- Add smooth transition animations between themes
- Integrate Catppuccin Tailwind plugin
- Add system theme detection (prefers-color-scheme)
- Add keyboard shortcut for theme cycling

## Acceptance Criteria
- All success criteria from CATPPUCCIN_THEME_PLAN.md met
- No visual regressions
- App builds and packages successfully
- Theme system is production-ready

## Reference
See CATPPUCCIN_THEME_PLAN.md Phase 4

title: Feature: Implement searchNotes action in store
description:
IPC handler for searchNotes exists but no corresponding store action. Current client-side search loads all note content into memory, won't scale.

Location: src/renderer/stores/notesStore.ts (missing action)
Impact: Medium - scalability issue for large note collections
Approach: Add searchNotes() action with loading state, use server-side search

title: Phase 7: Automated Narrative Generation
description: Implement scheduled daily narrative generation with node-cron, multi-tier summarization (daily→weekly→monthly), state machine for narrative lifecycle, and incremental summarization logic.

title: Install and configure node-cron
description: Install node-cron package. Set up daily task runner (11 PM). Test scheduling in background worker window.

title: Implement notification system
description: Set up native OS notifications. Create notification templates for narratives ready. Handle user interaction (click to view).

title: Create summary storage schema
description: Design database table for generated narratives. Fields: id, type (daily/weekly/monthly), content, source_notes, created_at. Add indexes.

title: Build UI for viewing summaries
description: Create Svelte component to display past summaries. Show timeline view. Support filtering by type and date range.

title: Design narrative state machine
description: Define states: raw notes → daily → weekly → monthly. Implement transitions and lifecycle management. Handle state validation.

title: Implement incremental summarization
description: Build logic for multi-tier summarization. Day 1-7: daily summaries. Week end: synthesize into weekly. Month end: create monthly summary.

title: Build dependency tracking system
description: Track dependencies (weekly requires all 7 dailies). Validate prerequisites before generation. Handle missing summaries gracefully.

title: Implement cache invalidation
description: Detect when source notes change. Invalidate dependent summaries. Trigger regeneration when needed.

title: Add 'regenerate summary' functionality
description: Create UI button to manually trigger regeneration. Pass updated notes to strategy. Replace existing summary.

title: Phase 6: AI Prompt Strategy System
description: Design PromptStrategy base class with template method pattern, PromptRegistry, and concrete strategies (DailySummary, WeeklySynthesis, MorningBriefing, YearEndReview). Manual implementation to learn async patterns.

title: Design PromptStrategy base class
description: Create abstract PromptStrategy class using template method pattern. Define lifecycle hooks: prepare(), buildPrompt(), formatResponse(). Establish strategy contract.

title: Add context management
description: Implement context window management. Pass previous summaries to strategies. Handle context length limits (4K, 8K, 100K tokens).

title: Implement PromptRegistry
description: Create registry for dynamic strategy registration. Support strategy discovery by name/type. Enable runtime strategy selection.

title: Implement DailySummaryStrategy
description: Create strategy for end-of-day narrative generation. Extract key activities, themes, ideas. Generate 300-word summary in first person.

title: Implement WeeklySynthesisStrategy
description: Create strategy for week-in-review generation. Synthesize 7 daily summaries. Identify patterns and themes across the week.

title: Implement MorningBriefingStrategy
description: Create strategy for morning reminders. Extract today's agenda, forgotten items from yesterday. Generate actionable briefing.

title: Implement YearEndReviewStrategy
description: Create strategy for annual review generation. Synthesize monthly summaries. Identify accomplishments, learnings, growth areas.

title: Implement ActionItemExtractionStrategy
description: Create LLM-based action item extraction. Parse notes for tasks, deadlines, commitments. Return structured action items.

title: Build prompt template system
description: Implement template literals with variable substitution. Support context injection (previous summaries, preferences). Handle template validation.

title: Create prompt configuration system
description: Design YAML/JSON schema for prompt definitions. Implement configuration loader. Support prompt versioning and iterations.

title: Phase 8: Polish and Production Features
description: Add auto-save, export functionality (Markdown/PDF/JSON), settings panel, keyboard shortcut system, undo/redo, onboarding flow, backup system, and data migration utilities.

title: Implement auto-save enhancement
description: Improve existing auto-save with better debouncing. Add visual indicators. Handle save conflicts gracefully.

title: Add export functionality
description: Export notes as Markdown (bundled .md files). Export as PDF (using electron print API). Export as JSON (for backup/migration).

title: Build settings panel
description: Create settings UI (preferences, API keys, theme). Use Electron dialog or in-app modal. Persist settings to electron-store.

title: Implement customizable keyboard shortcuts
description: Create shortcut configuration system. Allow users to customize shortcuts. Show shortcut hints in UI.

title: Add enhanced undo/redo
description: Extend TipTap's undo/redo. Add history panel showing recent changes. Support undo across app restarts.

title: Create onboarding flow
description: Build first-run experience. Explain key features. Collect user preferences (AI API key, theme). Show sample notes.

title: Implement backup system
description: Auto-backup database and notes to local directory. Support manual backup trigger. Include restore functionality.

title: Add data migration utilities
description: Import from other note apps (Obsidian, Notion, Evernote). Handle format conversion. Validate imported data.

title: Polish UI and fix bugs
description: Final UI polish pass. Fix reported bugs. Improve responsiveness. Test edge cases.

title: Cleanup: Remove unused IPC handler boilerplate
description:
Dead code in main.ts (lines 20-28): unused IPC handler with on/send pattern. No corresponding renderer code calls this, leftover from template.

Impact: Low - 8 lines of dead code, causes confusion about IPC API
Approach: Delete entirely

title: Phase 3: Note Filter System
description: Implement configuration-driven filter architecture with FilterInterface base class, FilterRegistry, and concrete filter implementations (TagFilter, DateRangeFilter, ContentFilter, CompositeFilter). This is manual implementation work to learn JavaScript patterns.

title: Design FilterInterface base class
description: Create base class/interface for all filters. Define common methods: apply(notes), serialize(), deserialize(). Establish contract for filter implementations.

title: Build filter UI component
description: Create Svelte component for filter selection and configuration. Integrate with existing sidebar. Show active filters and allow removal.

title: Implement FilterRegistry
description: Create registry system for dynamic filter registration. Support filter discovery, instantiation by type, and listing available filters. Use Map data structure.

title: Implement TagFilter
description: Create filter for notes with specific tags. Support single tag and multiple tags. Handle tag normalization (lowercase, trim).

title: Implement DateRangeFilter
description: Create filter for notes within date range. Support start date, end date, and single date. Handle edge cases (null dates, invalid ranges).

title: Implement ContentFilter
description: Create filter for notes containing text. Support case-insensitive search, regex patterns. Search in title and content fields.

title: Implement CompositeFilter
description: Create filter that combines multiple filters with AND/OR logic. Support nested composition. Implement filter chain pattern.

title: Build filter configuration system
description: Design JSON/YAML schema for filter configuration. Implement configuration loader. Support filter presets and saved filters.

title: Add filter serialization/deserialization
description: Implement toJSON() and fromJSON() methods for all filters. Support saving and loading filter configurations. Handle version compatibility.

title: Create unit tests for filter system
description: Write Jest tests for all filter types. Test edge cases, error handling, composition. Aim for 80%+ coverage.

title: Fix: Improve keyboard shortcut platform detection
description:
Keyboard shortcut modifier logic in keyboardShortcuts.ts allows ctrl and meta to be interchangeable, causing confusing cross-platform behavior.

Location: src/renderer/utils/keyboardShortcuts.ts (lines 23-25)
Impact: Medium - incorrect shortcut behavior on Windows/Linux
Approach: Use process.platform for proper macOS vs Windows/Linux detection

title: Phase 5: AI Infrastructure Setup
description: Set up Anthropic SDK, secure API key storage, streaming response handler with IPC bridging, and background worker window for scheduled tasks.

title: Install Anthropic SDK
description: Install @anthropic-ai/sdk package. Configure TypeScript types. Test basic API connection.

title: Implement secure API key storage
description: Use electron-store or system keychain for API key storage. Create settings UI for key entry. Validate key on save.

title: Create streaming response handler
description: Implement streaming handler in main process. Bridge streaming events through IPC to renderer. Handle errors and connection issues.

title: Build streaming UI component
description: Create Svelte component to display streaming AI text. Show loading states, progress indicator. Handle stream completion.

title: Integrate TipTap streamContent
description: Connect AI streaming to TipTap's streamContent command. Test streaming directly into editor. Handle Markdown parsing during stream.

title: Create background worker window
description: Set up hidden BrowserWindow for background tasks. Configure Node.js access. Test scheduled operation execution.

title: Optional: Set up Ollama integration
description: Install Ollama. Configure local model (Llama 3.2 3B). Test local inference for categorization tasks.

title: Test end-to-end AI integration
description: Write test prompt for narrative generation. Verify streaming works. Check error handling and recovery.

title: Refactor: Create reusable store subscription hook for Svelte components
description:
Identical Zustand subscription pattern repeated across 5+ Svelte components (App, Sidebar, EditorView, NoteList, Editor). Each component manually subscribes/unsubscribes.

Impact: High - ~30-40 lines of boilerplate, error-prone (memory leak risk)
Approach: Create useStore() custom hook or Svelte store wrapper

title: Refactor: Use lazy initialization for app configuration
description:
config.ts calls app.getPath() at module load time. Will fail if imported before app initialization, hard to test/override.

Location: src/config.ts (line 6)
Impact: Medium - potential initialization race condition
Approach: Use lazy initialization with cached getUserDataDir() function

title: Refactor: Extract editor prose styles to CSS module
description:
100+ lines of global prose styling in Editor.svelte with hardcoded colors. Not reusable, makes theming difficult.

Location: src/renderer/components/Editor.svelte (lines 129-228)
Impact: Medium - token waste, theme changes difficult
Approach: Extract to CSS module or use Tailwind prose plugin

title: Fix: Use logger utility consistently throughout codebase
description:
Logger utility exists but is inconsistently used. Direct console.log/error/warn calls scattered across main.ts, connection.ts, fileManager.ts, notesService.ts, and notesHandlers.ts.

Impact: Medium - no centralized log control, harder debugging
Approach: Import logger everywhere, add ESLint rule to prevent direct console calls

title: Refactor: Centralize validation constants
description:
Magic numbers for validation limits scattered across validation.ts without constants. No single source of truth between database schema and validation rules.

Location: src/utils/validation.ts (lines 13, 19, 25, 30)
Impact: Medium - harder to maintain, potential schema/validation mismatch
Approach: Create src/config/validation.ts with VALIDATION_LIMITS constants

title: Refactor: Replace custom date formatting with library
description:
Custom date formatting logic in NoteListItem.svelte reinvents functionality available in date-fns or dayjs. Manual date math is error-prone and wastes tokens.

Location: src/renderer/components/NoteListItem.svelte (lines 8-23)
Impact: Medium - ~16 lines, error-prone for timezone handling
Approach: Use date-fns/formatRelative or create shared utility

title: Refactor: Extract IPC handler error handling pattern
description:
The try-catch-console.error-throw pattern is duplicated across all 6 IPC handlers in src/ipc/notesHandlers.ts. Create a generic IPC handler wrapper to eliminate ~60 lines of boilerplate.

Location: src/ipc/notesHandlers.ts (lines 6-97)
Impact: High - reduces token waste, improves maintainability
Approach: Create createHandler<T,R>() wrapper function

title: Phase 9: Distribution and Deployment
description: Configure electron-builder for production builds, set up code signing, implement auto-update mechanism, create installers (DMG/NSIS/AppImage), build CI/CD pipeline, and document release process.

title: Configure electron-builder
description: Set up electron-builder config. Define build targets (macOS, Windows, Linux). Configure app metadata and icons.

title: Set up code signing
description: Obtain code signing certificates (macOS Developer ID, Windows code signing cert). Configure signing in build process. Test signed builds.

title: Implement auto-update mechanism
description: Integrate electron-updater. Set up update server or GitHub releases. Implement update notifications and installation flow.

title: Create platform installers
description: Build DMG installer for macOS. Create NSIS installer for Windows. Generate AppImage for Linux. Test installation flows.

title: Build CI/CD pipeline
description: Set up GitHub Actions workflow. Automate builds on push/tag. Publish releases automatically. Run tests in CI.

title: Create release process documentation
description: Document versioning strategy. Write release checklist. Create changelog template. Document distribution process.

title: Generate privacy policy and terms
description: Draft privacy policy (data handling, AI usage). Create terms of service. Add to app and distribution sites.

title: Test distribution packages
description: Test installers on clean machines. Verify auto-update works. Check code signature validity. Test uninstall process.

title: Refactor: Centralize type definitions
description:
Type definitions scattered and duplicated across schema.ts, preload.d.ts, and fileManager.ts. NoteFrontmatter doesn't match schema definition. No single source of truth.

Impact: Medium - maintenance burden, risk of type mismatches
Approach: Create src/types/index.ts, consolidate all types, import everywhere

title: Phase 4: Search Implementation
description: Integrate MiniSearch for full-text search with provider pattern architecture allowing future swap to vector search. Build search UI with result highlighting and debouncing.

title: Install and configure MiniSearch
description: Install MiniSearch library. Configure search options (fields, boost, fuzzy matching). Set up search index initialization in main process.

title: Design SearchProvider interface
description: Create abstract SearchProvider class/interface. Define methods: indexNote(), searchNotes(), updateIndex(). Plan for future VectorSearchProvider.

title: Implement MiniSearchProvider
description: Concrete implementation of SearchProvider using MiniSearch. Handle incremental index updates. Implement result ranking and highlighting.

title: Create SearchFactory pattern
description: Implement factory for provider instantiation. Support configuration-based provider selection. Enable easy swap between search providers.

title: Add search IPC handlers
description: Create IPC handlers for search operations. Expose provider-agnostic search API. Handle async search results.

title: Build search UI with debouncing
description: Enhance existing SearchBar component with debouncing. Add result highlighting. Show search statistics (X results in Y ms).

title: Implement search result highlighting
description: Highlight search terms in note titles and previews. Support multiple matched terms. Use mark.js or custom implementation.

title: Add search persistence
description: Persist search index to file. Implement index rebuild on app start. Handle index corruption gracefully.

title: Test: Add test coverage for critical paths
description:
No test files found in codebase. Critical paths without tests:
- Database repositories (notesRepository, tagsRepository)
- Service layer (notesService orchestration)
- File operations (fileManager disk I/O)
- IPC handlers (communication layer)
- Validation rules
- Store state management

Impact: High - no safety net for refactoring, database/file bugs uncaught
Approach: Add Vitest, create test files for each critical module
